sidebar.formulaBody: Index = log(1 + minutes of use) √ó 15 + (activities completed^1.5 √ó 6) + bonus
sidebar.formulaBonus: Bonus: +10 if you use more than 60 min, +8 if you complete 5 or more activities.
sidebar.formulaProgress: Progress: The bar shows your progress towards the daily goal.

chatMenu.hint: Enter a username to send a friend request.

enforce.Math: Focus on improving student performance in mathematics. Use targeted exercises and additional practice materials to reinforce understanding and build confidence in challenging areas like calculus and probability.
enforce.Science: Enhance science comprehension through hands-on experiments and real-world applications. Students need more practice with physics concepts and chemical reactions.
enforce.SocialStudies: Improve historical analysis and geographical understanding. Incorporate more primary source analysis and map reading activities to build critical thinking skills.
enforce.Spanish: Strengthen language acquisition through immersive activities. Focus on conversational practice and grammar reinforcement to improve overall fluency.

recommendation.Math: Focus on practicing quadratic equations with real-world examples. Consider using visual aids to help students understand the graphical representation of equations.
recommendation.Science: Incorporate hands-on experiments to help students visualize scientific concepts. Use real-world examples to make the material more engaging and relatable.
recommendation.SocialStudies: Use interactive timelines and maps to help students understand historical context. Encourage discussions about current events to make connections with past events.
recommendation.Spanish: Practice conversational Spanish through role-playing activities. Incorporate multimedia resources like videos and songs to improve listening comprehension.

classCreation.title: Create a Section
classCreation.pageSubtitle: Create it once, use it for a year

aboutList.step1: 1. Enter the grade and section number and automatically create a new section
aboutList.step2: 2. Once created you will get a QR Code, let the students scan it to join the section
aboutList.step3: 3. Done! now your students will be assigned to this section for the remainder of the year

alerts.loginRequired: You must be logged in to create a section.
alerts.exists: A class with that grade and section already exists.
alerts.noLink: No link available to share yet.

modal.title: Class Created

recommendationsText.Math: Focus on improving your performance in mathematics. Use targeted exercises and additional practice materials to reinforce understanding and build confidence in challenging areas like calculus and probability.
recommendationsText.Science: Enhance science comprehension through hands-on experiments and real-world applications. You need more practice with physics concepts and chemical reactions.
recommendationsText.SocialStudies: Improve historical analysis and geographical understanding. Incorporate more primary source analysis and map reading activities to build critical thinking skills.
recommendationsText.Spanish: Strengthen language acquisition through immersive activities. Focus on conversational practice and grammar reinforcement to improve overall fluency.

studentQuestions.q1: How do I calculate the area under a curve using integrals?
studentQuestions.q2: What is the difference between a derivative and an integral?
studentQuestions.q3: Can you explain the chain rule again?
studentQuestions.q4: When should I use the quadratic formula?
studentQuestions.q5: What are the applications of trigonometry in real life?

lore.capybara: Born in the tranquil wetlands of the Pantanal in Brazil, {{name}} grew up surrounded by diverse wildlife. Known for their amicable nature, they often host gatherings by the riverbank where animals of all species mingle in peace. A true ambassador of relaxation and harmony.
lore.sloth: Hailing from the lush, misty canopies of Costa Rica, {{name}} has mastered the art of energy conservation. A meticulous observer who descends only when absolutely necessary, they have watched the forest change over decades, gaining wisdom through silent observation.

questions.question: How do you prefer to learn something new?
questions.hint: Think about your favorite learning method.

questions.question: In a school project, what do you prefer to do?
options: Work alone and at my own pace
questions.hint: Think about how you like to work.

questions.question: What activity do you enjoy most in your free time?
options: Watching movies or browsing social media

questions.question: When solving a difficult problem:
options: I talk out loud or discuss with someone
I draw diagrams or mind maps
I build models or simulate situations
I write lists and analyze data

questions.question: Do you like learning using technology?
options: Yes, I prefer online classes and videos

questions.question: When you memorize information:
options: I repeat out loud several times

questions.question: Do you prefer working alone or with others?
options: With others, I learn more by sharing
questions.hint: Think about your social learning style.

questions.question: When learning a new language:
options: I listen to conversations and music
I practice speaking with native speakers

questions.question: What type of instructions do you prefer?
questions.hint: Think about which format you understand best.

questions.question: When exploring a new topic:
options: I research on my own first
I experiment until I understand it

questions.question: Do you like studying with music?
In a class, you prefer the teacher to:
Do you like working with patterns and logic?
options: I prefer social and human subjects

questions.question: When learning about nature:
options: I prefer going out and observing
questions.hint: Think about your connection with nature.

questions.question: Do you prefer making discoveries yourself?
options: Yes, I like exploring and experimenting
I prefer researching in a group

associative.title: Associative Learning! üîó
associative.description: This type of learning occurs when you associate external stimuli or events with an idea or behavior. This way of learning is characterized by being deep and effective, and is applied through positive reinforcement to encourage study habits or specific behaviors.

nonAssociative.title: Non-Associative Learning! üîÑ
nonAssociative.description: This occurs when your response changes to a stimulus that repeats over time or is continuous, either because you get used to it or because you internalize it. Your sensitivity varies over time.

cooperative.title: Cooperative Learning! ü§ù
cooperative.description: In this type of learning you work in groups with roles and functions assigned by the teacher. The professor forms teams, assigns roles, and directs the process. It's common in active methodologies like challenge-based learning.
recommendations: Fulfill your role on the team
Take advantage of structured group projects

collaborative.title: Collaborative Learning! üë•
collaborative.description: In collaborative learning the teacher proposes the topic or poses a problem and you decide with your classmates how to approach the project, fostering autonomy and joint decision-making.

emotional.title: Emotional Learning! ‚ù§Ô∏è
emotional.description: With it you learn to know your emotions and manage them efficiently. Emotional learning contributes to your well-being and personal development, and favors healthy interpersonal relationships.

experiential.title: Experiential Learning! üåü
experiential.description: It consists of learning from the situations you live or even from the mistakes you make. This type of learning can vary greatly from person to person and requires a certain amount of self-reflection work.

implicit.title: Implicit Learning! üîÆ
implicit.description: This occurs when you learn something, generally, without intentionality. It happens without you realizing it and almost automatically, like walking, talking, or moving.

explicit.title: Explicit Learning! üìù
explicit.description: This does have an intention and there is also awareness: you are conscious that you are learning. It allows you to acquire new information about people, places, and objects, and requires attention and exercise from your brain.

memoristic.title: Memoristic Learning! üß†
memoristic.description: For a long time it was the predominant method in education. It involves fixing concepts in memory and recalling them almost automatically. Although it doesn't always imply deep understanding, it remains useful in some contexts.

observational.title: Observational Learning! üëÅÔ∏è
observational.description: This type of learning requires at least two people: one more expert who performs an action as an example (model) and the one who observes and imitates or reproduces the action (learner). It's key in teaching practical and social skills.

discovery.title: Discovery Learning! üîç
discovery.description: It's one of the most active types of learning. Besides learning by participating, you go further: you don't settle for just what's taught. You search for information on your own, organize data in your cognitive schema, and relate it to previous knowledge.

receptive.title: Receptive Learning! üìñ
receptive.description: Could be considered one of the passive types of learning. You limit yourself to receiving information, whether oral, written, or audiovisual, and internalize that content to reproduce it later. It's useful in certain contexts.

significant.title: Significant Learning! ‚≠ê
significant.description: Of all the types of learning, this is one of the most effective. It consists of collecting, selecting, and organizing the information transmitted to you to establish a relationship between this new knowledge and what you already had.
recommendations: Connect new concepts to what you know

first_login.title: Fresh Start
first_login.description: Log in for the first time.

math_wizard.title: Math Wizard
math_wizard.description: Get a perfect score in a Math quiz.

scholar.title: The Scholar
scholar.lore: Born in the Great Library of Aren, this capybara has read more books than there are leaves in the jungle. Seeks truth in every equation.
scholar.description: A tactical genius who always thinks three steps ahead.

dreamer.title: The Dreamer
dreamer.lore: Believes imagination is the strongest weapon. Spends days creating new worlds and creative solutions to old problems.
dreamer.description: Their mind is a universe of infinite possibilities.

zen.title: Zen Master
zen.lore: Keeps calm even during the hardest exams. Their superpower is absolute concentration and inner peace.
zen.description: Calm before, during, and after the storm.

warrior.title: The Warrior
warrior.lore: Veteran of a thousand knowledge battles. Always ready to defend their answers and conquer new topics.
warrior.description: The unstoppable force that protects the weak.
